title: Specialist, Security & Intelligence - Production
overview: The Specialist, Security & Intelligence - Production role at Netflix is responsible for delivering tactical-level results on the design and implementation of security and response programs for productions, assessing risks to an evolving production strategy, and developing effective business relationships with law enforcement and security networks. They should have 3-5 years of relevant experience, advanced degree preferred, and the ability to interpret regional security signals, communicate analysis to stakeholders, and travel internationally as required.
description:
Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with more than 222 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team.

The Security & Intelligence Team supports our studio functions globally. This Los Angeles-based role will report to the Senior Manager, Security & Intelligence - Production. Partnering with Physical Production, Content Security, Post Production, Business and Legal Affairs, and Content, the role will be instrumental in assessing risks to an evolving production strategy in a dynamic and exciting UCAN region.

extras.title: Responsibilities:
content: Deliver tactical-level results on the design and implementation of security and response programs for productions
Develop/review risk assessments, design security plans, and coordinate local support for our productions in alignment with relevant internal and external stakeholders
Develop/share specialized guidance for higher-risk production activities and in higher-risk locations
Develop and maintain effective business relationships with Local/State/Federal law enforcement, emergency response, and trusted security networks
Utilize analysis of dynamic global and local security events to keep productions secure and resilient
Support wider team on specialized projects as needed

extras.title: Qualifications:
content: 3 - 5 years of relevant experience, which can include security, intelligence, military, media production, or NGO
Advanced degree in relevant subject matter preferred
Experience with production, talent, and vendor relations
Must be business fluent in English; additional language proficiency a plus

extras.title: Ability to:
content: Interpret regional security signals and data, and conduct risk assessments
Maintain an awareness of risk trends affecting the regional entertainment sector
Communicate relevant analysis and forecasting to key stakeholders
Interact with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders
